sense.gloss: setsubun, last day of winter in the traditional Japanese calendar (usu. February 3 or 4), day of the bean scattering ceremony
last day of any season (according to the traditional Japanese calendar)

sdata.j: ↑節分↑↓|せつぶん|↓には、↑二↑↓ふた↓つの↑季↑↓き↓↑節↑↓せつ↓を↑分↑↓わ↓けるという↑意味↑↓いみ↓があります。
sdata.e: Setsubun means "the day between two seasons."
